term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - hydrometeor in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: hydrometeor

item.text: Any condensed water particle in the atmosphere of sufficient size to be potentially capable of undergoing precipitation (in fogs, clouds, some hazes, raindrops, snowflakes, etc.).

sources.item: PAC, 1990, 62, 2167. 'Glossary of atmospheric chemistry terms (Recommendations 1990)' on page 2195 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199062112167)
